comment: Dr. Eyles was not a good teacher. He scrolled though PPTs and read exactly what was on the slides with no added thoughts. There was a cheating incident during the class so the the final test was rewritten. Unfortunately, the lectures were not adapted so there was no link to the material tested. Very poor class.

Decent teacher, all assignments are "Curved" So they all give a good amount of extra credit if your not completely bad at it. You have a biweekly homework assignment, 2 tests, and one project at the end. It wasn't that hard and it was an easy A for a CS Major

2 tests, 1 project, 1 final, 4 assignments. tests, final, project makes up for 60% and the 4 assignment makes up for 40% (at least in my class) He drops the lowest grade from the tests/finals/projects. project is 2 in 1. paper and powerpoint You can earns more than 100 points on your assignments and project. Which boosts your grade tremendously.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Easy teacher, lays out most of the material in layman's terms. Gives quite a bit of extra credit points and drops one grade. There is a research paper and presentation which are on a topic of your choice which doesn't make it too bad. His tests are a little more in depth than the material in class, but not too bad. Lab attendance is optional

TONS of extra credit opportunities, TAKE ADVANTAGE. The tests will catch you off guard so study up. Everything else just youtube. Showing to class is unnecessary if you commit outside of class. reads straight from lecture slides. Easy A. Don't take his accommodations for granted. Get ahead of the game.
Great guy very chill he doesnt just want you to pass but also wants you to pass with a great grade. You really just have to do the work and you'll be fine.

Dr. Eyles is absolutely fabulous! He gives lots of assignments but all of them prepare you for the tests. He also gives lots of optional assignments, I recommend you do them all, because they only help your grade. There is also a large research paper, but it's not difficult. Overall, I completely recommend him!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Eyles is an interesting character. He seems reserved at first but is pretty loose and humorous. He requires class participation by calling you out and asking for your opinion (you end up learning a lot more). The homework isn't terrible, and the tests are easy for the course. There is a big research project, though, which is odd for a coding class.

Lenient with grading, at least from what I heard. But assigns too much REPETITIVE work for absolutely irrelevant stuff. An example is hand-sketching about 70 linear graphs because he thinks it is beneficial. For a data structures class... It is as if he does not have the understanding that assignments cost time and repetition is a waste of it.
Most homeworks/ projects are optional for grades, but if you do them you will pass the exams easily. Pretty much do the work to get an A.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Eyles is unique in the way he presents material in class. I'm currently taking him for concepts. This is his first semester teaching, I believe, so his class was structured a little badly. However, he's willing to work with you, and he strives to see students succeed. Oh! And he's got an impressive resume.
